page.title: 06Churches in Capel St Mary
page.content: The churches within Capel are the Parish Church of St Mary which is Anglican,the Methodist church and a redundant church at Little Wenham.The latter was built in the 14th C and repaired 1981 but is now only used on special occasions. About 1/2 the school children dont't go to church.More go to the Methodist than the Parish but the parish church is much more popular with adults.Least children go to the Roman Catholic services which are allowed to be held in the Parish Church. The Methodist church was built in 1883. The minister is Rev.Hawkes and he has been there for 2 years.The regular congregation is about 185. The Rector of the Parish church takes services,visits people(especially if they are sick),takes assemblies and teaches R.E.in the primary school.
